page.title: 08Employment
page.content: Most people work on farms.There are not many farm workers as there used to be because of modern machines. People often work on the farms for part of the year like potato picking and sorting. A few people work for the Forestry Commission.Most mothers work or want to work. They might work in shops in nearby towns like Knighton or Presteigne or perhaps in the trouser factory in Knighton. Two mothers from this school are nurses and one drives a school bus. Fathers might be builders and one is a printer and another a lorry mechanic at Llandrindod 20 miles away. Most work on their own farms. Lots of young people have to move away because there are not many really good jobs round here. Sons will often grow up and take over the farm but it is hard for young men to find good jobs.
